title: cellranger_atac_count
description: Align fastq files using Cell Ranger ATAC count.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `sample_S1_L001_R1_001.fastq.gz;sample_S1_L001_R2_001.fastq.gz`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The fastq
input.help_text: Type: List of `file`, required, example: `sample_S1_L001_R1_001.fastq.gz;sample_S1_L001_R2_001.fastq.gz`, multiple_sep: `";"`. The fastq.gz files to align. Can also be a single directory containing fastq.gz files.

reference.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `reference.tar.gz`. The path to Cell Ranger reference tar
reference.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `reference.tar.gz`. The path to Cell Ranger reference tar.gz file. Can also be a directory.

output.description: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output`, example: `/path/to/output`. The folder to store the alignment results
output.help_text: Type: `file`, required, default: `$id.$key.output`, example: `/path/to/output`. The folder to store the alignment results.

description.description: Type: `string`, default: ``. Sample description to embed in output files
description.help_text: Type: `string`, default: ``. Sample description to embed in output files

force_cells.description: Type: `integer`. Define the top N barcodes with the most fragments overlapping peaks as cells and override the cell calling algorithm
force_cells.help_text: Type: `integer`. Define the top N barcodes with the most fragments overlapping peaks as cells and override the cell calling algorithm. N must be a positive integer <= 20,000. Use this option if the number of cells estimated by Cell Ranger ATAC is not consistent with the barcode rank plot

peaks.description: Type: `file`. Override peak caller: specify peaks to use in downstream analyses from supplied 3-column BED file
peaks.help_text: Type: `file`. Override peak caller: specify peaks to use in downstream analyses from supplied 3-column BED file. The supplied peaks file must be sorted by position and not contain overlapping peaks; comment lines beginning with # are allowed

dim_reduce.description: Type: `string`, default: `lsa`, choices: ``lsa`, `pca`, `plsa``. Dimensionality reduction mode for clustering
dim_reduce.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `lsa`, choices: ``lsa`, `pca`, `plsa``. Dimensionality reduction mode for clustering

subsample_rate.description: Type: `double`, example: `0.1`. Downsample to preserve this fraction of reads
subsample_rate.help_text: Type: `double`, example: `0.1`. Downsample to preserve this fraction of reads

lanes.description: Type: List of `string`, example: `1,3`, multiple_sep: `";"`. bcl2fastq option
lanes.help_text: Type: List of `string`, example: `1,3`, multiple_sep: `";"`. bcl2fastq option. Semicolon-delimited series of lanes to demultiplex. Use this if you have a sample sheet for an entire flow cell but only want to generate a few lanes for further 10x Genomics analysis.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
